BETTER FILMS SPEAKER COMING To Address Mass Meeting At Bijou Feb. 5. Movement Sponsored In Knoxville By Members Of Ossoli Circle.
A mass meeting will be held in the interest of Better Films at the Bijou theatre Sunday afternoon February 5th, at 3 o'clock under the auspices of Ossoli circle. Mrs. Phillip Spud [Speed], of the University of Virginia, a speaker of national reputation, will be the chief speaker at this meeting. She is to be sent here by the national committee for Better Films, and is considered an able, speaker, courteous and cultured. a club woman with much experience in motion picture betterment, both as a mother and a worker. She heartily agrees with the position taken by the General Federation of Women's clubs concerning the best way of promoting improvement of the movies. Selection—not censorship is the solution, they claim. The National Board discussed this subject thor- oughly with motion picture theatre owners of America, and has their assurance that they desire to co-operate whole-heartedly with community groups which will support finer pictures, family programs and entertainments for young people. The desire for selected pictures, for cooperation with community exhibitors, and for larger assumption of responsibility by parents has grown rapidly in all parts of the United States. The National Board of Review has led in this movement for a wise and permanent solution for the entire country. The management of the Bijou theatre has offered the use of the theatre free of charge for this meeting, and Mr. Frank Nelson has consented to take charge of the musical feature of the program.
